skill.name: python-packaging
skill.description: Create distributable Python packages with proper project structure, setup.py/pyproject.toml, and publishing to PyPI. Use when packaging Python libraries, creating CLI tools, or distributing Python code.
skill.summary: Create distributable Python packages with proper project structure, setup.py/pyproject.toml, and pub...
skill.author: ActiveInferenceInstitute

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guides and code examples for Python packaging. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond reading its own content.

content.value_statement: Packaging Python projects for distribution requires understanding modern standards like pyproject.toml and PyPI publishing. This skill provides comprehensive patterns and templates for creating professional Python packages.
actual_capabilities: Create proper Python package structure with src layout
Write pyproject.toml with complete metadata and dependencies
Configure entry points for CLI tools
Publish packages to PyPI and TestPyPI
Set up GitHub Actions for automated publishing
limitations: Does not execute packaging commands directly
Does not interact with PyPI API for publishing
Does not validate existing package configurations
Does not handle dependency resolution conflicts

use_cases.title: Package Python libraries
use_cases.description: Create professional Python libraries with proper structure, metadata, and documentation for PyPI distribution.

use_cases.title: Build command-line tools
use_cases.description: Create installable command-line tools with click or argparse, registered as console entry points.

use_cases.title: Automate package releases
use_cases.description: Set up CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, building, and publishing Python packages to package indexes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic package setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a Python package with pyproject.toml. I want to package a library called 'myutils' with requests and click as dependencies.

prompt_templates.title: CLI entry points
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I configure a CLI tool using click with entry points in pyproject.toml so users can run 'mytool' after pip install?

prompt_templates.title: PyPI publishing
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the steps to publish my Python package to PyPI? Include using TestPyPI first and API token authentication.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me a complete pyproject.toml for a production package with dynamic versioning, optional dependencies, type hints, and test configuration.

output_examples.input: Create a minimal pyproject.toml for a Python library called 'datautils' with pandas dependency
output: pyproject.toml with build-system, project metadata, and dependencies configured
src layout recommended for clean package isolation
Entry points section ready for CLI tools or plugins

best_practices: Use src layout for better package isolation and cleaner imports
Include all metadata: classifiers, URLs, authors for professional packages
Test on TestPyPI before publishing to production PyPI
anti_patterns: Using setup.py instead of modern pyproject.toml configuration
Including __init__.py in namespace package root directories
Publishing without testing installation in a clean virtual environment

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: Define requires-python in pyproject.toml. Most packages support 3.8+ for broad compatibility.

faq.question: How do I handle optional dependencies?
faq.answer: Use [project.optional-dependencies] with groups like dev, docs, all for different use cases.

faq.question: Can I use this with Poetry or Hatch?
faq.answer: Yes. Change build-backend to hatchling or configure Poetry accordingly while following the same structure.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only skill that reads its own content. No external access or code execution.

faq.question: Why is my package failing to build?
faq.answer: Check build-system requires includes setuptools>=61.0 and ensure all package-dir mappings are correct.

faq.question: How is this different from Poetry?
faq.answer: This skill covers standard PEP-compliant packaging using setuptools. Poetry adds dependency management on top.
